storyInfo: Ebenholz is taken to a spire by a young man named Lessing. The kidnappers are preparing a ritual to summon the Witch King's Genesis Horn, using the Voice of Mundane in Ebenholz. Viviana and the tuner visit the painter's residence and are ambushed by the Witch King's remnants.

attributes.content: The sound I heard when I was passed out...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It was you, sharpening your sword.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It got some dirt on it on the way back.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: It had better be sharp enough.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: My neck is sturdier than you might think.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That's not for you to decide.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: Hah... Are we on top of a spire?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm not going to let you jump off, if that's what you mean. As I said, there are no second chances.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: It almost sounds like you want me to live.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It doesn't matter what I want. It's my responsibility.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: You also have own responsibilities, don't you? You returned to Leithanien. Don't run away again, like a child.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: Perhaps your employer forgot to mention this, but Graf Urtica is dead.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But the Urtica Grafschaft still exists.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: You're still the last of House Urtica.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: But I never wanted‚Äî
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Running away doesn't make problems disappear.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: No one can choose their birth. In that sense, we're all the same.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: Is that what you tell yourself to justify serving as an executioner for that evil old fart? That you had no choice but to become his follower?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Nein. It's how I remind myself what it took to gain the freedom I have now.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Using the name Urtica, the one you call an 'evil old fart' changed my family's destiny.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: Everything I do today, I do to protect the hard-earned freedom of myself and many like me.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: You're... thanking the Witch King?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm just stating a fact.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: A 'fact,' huh?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What about the 'fact' that he spilled so much blood? What about the 'fact' that his remnants have claimed so many innocent victims?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Did you think you could ignore all the pain he inflicted on others, just because of some convenient 'fact'?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The Witch King is dead. Let the historians, politicians, and everyone else with too much time on their hands judge his deeds.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: I'm a warrior. My only concern is the battle in front of me, and the battle to come.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: If he truly left anything behind, then whether his legacy is good or bad isn't up to him anymore. It's up to those who make use of it.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: As his heir, that's how you should be thinking.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: Don't you dare look at me like that!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Your wounds are going to open up.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: I don't need sympathy from a remnant of the Witch King!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Graf‚Äî
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: Not another word!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ebenholz.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: Which of us do you really think isn't brave enough to face the 'facts' of the Witch King?
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: That'll do, Lessing.
...Welcome back.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Are the Arts ready?
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: Arts...?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Hopefully what's in your head will come in useful, lamb of Urtica.
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: Now, let me see it‚Äî
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: Argh!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The melody is surprisingly intact, considering Leithanians know nothing of souls.
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: Sometimes I wonder if these people meticulously recorded even what Herkunftshorn mumbled in his sleep...
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: I almost miss those metaphors of his, when he used to curse out his tutor.
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: Y-You knew the old fart? Who are you?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Old fart? Is that how you talk about the elders of your own family? I thought you Leithanians were all about etiquette and manners. Well, that's the one thing you have in common with him, I suppose.
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: I have NOTHING in common with him!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Stop screaming. Are you a three-month old baby? Crying any louder won't make anyone listen.
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: Why don't you do something useful with your mouth? I could teach you some vocal Arts that can be cast with your tongue alone.
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: I'm not taking lessons from a minion of the Witch King!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: A ball of Arts? Was that what hit you the last time, Lessing?
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: I was careless.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: How many times do I have to tell you: You need to do more than swing your sword around! Train your Arts perception! I hope you never tell anyone I raised you, you stupid sheep!
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: I never have.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: As for you, I suppose it's noteworthy that you can manage that without an Arts unit.
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: But your manipulation of energy couldn't be more clumsy. Are you trying to blow yourself up? Who taught you to use your lesions like that? The imbeciles in the spires?
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: It's all the Witch King's‚Äî
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Fools. They learned from Herkunftshorn's madness, but without a sliver of his skill.
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: Mmph‚ÄîArgh!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That's better, my little lamb. It's best that you stay put, for everyone's safety.
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: Check the defensive enchantment, Lessing.
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: Professor Hoffmann is on his way. You should wait until he arrives.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: We need to get this over with quickly, before we draw the attention of the Empresses' Voice and the Gesatzsw√§chter.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Fine. Gerhard won't be of much help, but it's not the worst thing for him to learn a lesson or two.
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: The Genesis Horn...
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: Hmph. How long as it been?
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: Karl Schmidt Street.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That place again? It's just an old street where a bunch of failed artists make their homes. I've already investigated it more than a few times.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Loris Bordin received a phone call before his death.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It was from an old baron by the name of Lukas, who lives on Karl Schmidt Street. Apparently, he's called for the Gendarmerie many times because of noise in the streets.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The old nobles are all like that, overreacting to the smallest things. They think they can order the people down here around like servants, even though they've been kicked out of their spires.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: What I mean is, I wouldn't take it too seriously.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Loris Bordin's actions indicate the likelihood of a plausible lead there.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...Were you even listening? Just because he went there doesn't mean he thought it was worth investigating.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: He may have been the commander of the Gendarmerie, but he was just a Vizegraf, and a houseless outsider at that.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Twenty-year-old honor made him little more than a glorified servant for the great nobles of a place like Zwillingst√ºrme.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: He answered the Baron's call, not because it was a useful lead, but because he had to.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: This information has little relevance to the objective.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Hey, don't just go! At least‚Äîwait up!
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That shop.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: 'Frau Schultz's Fine Hats'? I don't usually wear hats because of my halo.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Just go in.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Good afternoon.
Good afternoon, meine Dame.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Oh... By your appearance, I take it you're a local?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You could say that.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Do you know how I can get to Karl Schmidt Street?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: I'm sorry, I'm new around here. I don't suppose young nobles like yourself leave their spires very often. I'll ask someone else.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: No need. Just follow this street until the fourth statue, then make a left. You'll see it in the distance.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: See what in the distance?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You didn't know? Karl Schmidt Street is also known as Marigold Alley.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Marigold...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It's where the great composer Karl Schmidt once lived.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: He wrote some famous pieces about marigolds under the sun, making the alley a kind of holy ground for art lovers.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Interesting. I've never read about that.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: A little anecdote, the kind you hear all over Zwillingst√ºrme. Hardly even a story.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Well, danke. For the directions and the story.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Incidentally, you're not old enough to be buying a graduation cap, are you?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Oh, I'm waiting for someone.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: If we happen to be heading to the same place... would you like to come with me?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...Thank you for the offer.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: But the music of the Kaiserinnen will guide me.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Very well.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: May the melody of Zwillingst√ºrme be ever long and winding, like the rivers and the clouds.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...You can come out now.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Explain your actions.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That was an Empresses' Voice who just passed by.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: She seemed decent enough, but unfortunately we're not walking the same path.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: You're a little later than we agreed on, Viviana.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I met... a remarkable young man on the streets.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Now I'm sure we're not the only ones looking into this case.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You sound a little sad about that.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Ja. The spy was practically a child.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: And...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You stopped. What's the matter?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I'm listening.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The music of the Kaiserinnen is still playing.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Zwillingst√ºrme still bathes in their wonderful melody.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But... can a melody played by divergent wills remain in harmony forever?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You fear the Empresses' Voice. Is your employer an enemy of the Empresses?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Are you out of your mind? Don't ask that question out on the street!
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: We'll be entering the alley soon. I will ask then.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Fine. You want to know if I'm in league with the people who killed Loris Bordin? Absolutely not.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: I'm a Lupo, which I would hope is obvious. I was born near Siracusa.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: In the early years of the Witch King's reign, not long after Siracusa broke away from Leithanien, how do you think he and his followers treated my people?
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: I was inquiring about you personally, not the history of your family.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Is there a difference?
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: I had assumed that you made your own choices of your own free will.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Free will? Not in my family. I was born to carry our destiny.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Just like the lady who recently became an Empresses' Voice. She went from Leithanien to Kazimierz, and from Kazimierz back to Leithanien. Was any of that her own choice?
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: I am inferring that it's complicated. This will make it difficult to discern friend from foe.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Hah... Why do you think they call Laterano Paradise?
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Stop.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What's the matter? Karl Schmidt Street is just ahead. The Empresses' Voice went there. Maybe Bordin really did find something.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: The alley has changed from before.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It is too quiet.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Are these pieces all by Frau Seemann?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Ja, meine Dame.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: All drafts of Der Tod des Hexenk√∂nigs.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I didn't dare touch them, nor did I understand them, so I left them where they were.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: What about anything else from the past few years?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The past few years... There's not much to show. She often said that her passion ended that autumn, twenty-three years ago. Would you like to peruse her earlier works?
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: If you don't mind.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Frau Seemann's early works are characterized by refined touches and bright, lively colors.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Frieda Seemann wanted to capture authentic emotions with her brush. She had an excellent memory, and made good use of Originium Arts to recreate snapshots in time.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: She was still young when I saw her in the Witch King's Spire for the first time.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: She had an almost Minoan liveliness to her, less of the stiffness of your average Leithanian noblewoman.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Her easy-going nature attracted people from all walks of life.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Frieda's friends used to hold poetry gatherings here in this alley... Your parents were among them.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: My parents? They came here too?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Did they never tell you? This is where they met.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Your father wasn't a Kurf√ºrst-in-waiting quite yet. He came from Sturmland to Einwald, and often participated in gatherings of young people in Marigold Alley.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: One day, a young woman of common stock mustered the courage to read a little poem she wrote at Frau Seemann's poetry gathering.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: And that was my mother?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: She never told me any of this.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Her brow's always been furrowed, for as far back as I can remember...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Lucinda Droste was a shy, gentle girl with soft, gleaming eyes. Gazing upon her was like sitting by the lakeside in summer, with a gentle breeze brushing by.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Werner fell in love at first sight, almost missing His Majesty's summons.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: If Brandt hadn't covered for him, he would have been part of a statue in front of the Spire by the time House Hochberg's soldiers arrived at Einwald.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: This was still during the reign of the Witch King?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Hard to believe, isn't it?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: But that era was resplendent in its own way, much like the painting before you.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: A resplendent... marigold.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: This painting looks familiar. I think I've seen it before.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But where?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.text: 'Viviana.'
'I'm sorry, but I need to take this painting away.'
'Your mother is gone. I'll have someone clear out the room.'
'I couldn't possibly leave you here with no one to take care of you.'
'Someone will be here to take you away soon.'
'Don't cry. You'll meet new friends out there. There will be people who love you, even without Mutti and Vati.'
'You'll see the marigolds with your own eyes.'
'See for me if they're blooming, like in the painting.'

attributes.content: ...A flower chasing the sun.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The clouds above Sturmland rarely clear up. It was cold and wet up in the spire. Father tried many things, and hired many casters, but could never get them to survive in the flower pots.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But here in this tiny Zwillingst√ºrme alley, they're everywhere.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It's... warm.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Where are you going, Viviana?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...An enemy?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Viviana!
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The music is faint, almost imperceptible.
It seems distant, but also nearby.
It transcends time, transcends memories, linking them in the same space.
You're going back.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.text: Ernst's condition deteriorated rapidly. Even the best healers the Twins could find couldn't save his life.

attributes.content: Which means you could be the new Kurf√ºrst of Sturmland.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.text: When I first came here, I thought I was going to be a poet.

attributes.content: What about Lucinda?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.text: I certainly hope she'll come with me, but I won't force her. She's talented. She could become a great painter under Frau Seemann's tutelage.

attributes.content: You love her, and she loves you.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.text: Which is why I can't lie to her.
I'm no longer the carefree youngest son of the Hochbergs. From this day forth, my life belongs to Sturmland and to House Hochberg. Not to myself.
The nobles will have a whole gaggle of young ladies lined up, all vying to be my wife.
I wouldn't be able to promise her anything, even if she were willing to come. If we lose the power struggle, she could end her days as a handmaiden in our spire.

attributes.content: His Majesty... the Witch King is dead. The Spire that towered over Leithanien has fallen. Our days of being slaves to fate were expected to be left in the past.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.text: At the very least, we now know that the name of our fate isn't 'the Witch King.'

attributes.content: Just give it one last try, won't you? Either take her with you, or stay here for her.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Just like the night when the Witch King fell, I pray that the kind and gentle will have their happy ending.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The music grows clearer.
Unlike the performance of the statues, this music is alive.
Like a kindly hand, it pulls her forward, down the stairs, away from the wind and rain.
It is close. Almost there. Down the stairs, and the sunlight is waiting outside‚Äî
The car is here.
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter

attributes.text: Lucinda is not here.
I must find her.

attributes.content: Everyone is waiting for you.
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter

attributes.content: The Witch King is dead. Your men must return to their lands, in accordance with our agreement with the Twins.
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter

attributes.content: You must leave the city before noon. The armies of the other Kurf√ºrsten are watching your every move.
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter

attributes.content: Sturmland... Nein, the fate of Leithanien falls on your shoulders.
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter

attributes.text: When did you become such a stranger, Brandt?
You always wear that helmet. I can't see your eyes. Sometimes, I can't even tell if it's you speaking, or another Gesatzsw√§chter.

attributes.content: Because it makes no difference whether it's me or another Gesatzsw√§chter.
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter

attributes.content: Leithanien cannot afford another civil war. Sturmland needs a Kurf√ºrst who the people will get behind.
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter

attributes.text: You're not here to protect me, are you?
Just like you didn't protect Ernst or father that night.

attributes.content: ...Do you remember, Werner? When I was selected for Gesatzsw√§chter training, I came to you and Ernst and told you I wanted to stay.
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter

attributes.text: You grew up with us and swore fealty to House Hochberg. You didn't want to go back on your vow.

attributes.content: But you told me‚Äî
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter

attributes.content: 'You're defending something far more important than any person's life, more important than House Hochberg.'
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter

attributes.content: I never forgot that. Not even for a moment.
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter

attributes.text: Alright then.
Is fate truly so impossible to resist, Brandt?

attributes.content: No, don't go.
Don't give up hope.
At least, not so easily...
The young Kurf√ºrst turns around and leaves, but Viviana does not want to follow. She tries her hardest to go back.
A golden glow always fills the alley in autumn. Her mother must be somewhere in there, simply unable to make it in time.
She runs, she searches.
Marigolds bloom under the sun, just like the hopes her parents once had for the future.
She wants to grab ahold of her mother, to grab ahold of her father's silhouette from the memory.
As though she could change something if she did.
Change the tragedy that was her father's life... and change her own.
Year after year, the golden flowers take in the city's joy, anger, and sorrow, remaining as bright as ever in bloom.
But some blooming hopes were left behind forever, twenty-three years ago.
Why...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Why couldn't I grab it?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Is fate truly so impossible to resist?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Viviana! Around you!
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Viviana looks up in a trance.
The music stops.
The melody seems to freeze in place, then becomes rushing energy.
Like dark clouds, the Arts tear the sunlight apart and rush toward her.
Ugh‚Äî!
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: No need to fear, I'm here with you.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: A cello...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Mental Arts.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The music is awakening our memories of Werner.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Mother... Father...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Over here, Viviana. I'll cover your ears with my hands.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: They're... gone...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I couldn't change anything...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Don't listen to it. Whatever you're seeing in your imagination isn't happening in the present.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The remnants of the Witch King are in this alley. They knew we were coming.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Ugh... there are too many of them.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I can't deal with them all. We need to escape‚Äî
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Another sound emerges.
It is like a melody, but cannot be sung. It is like a bell, but continuous, without pausing.
It is a declaration that rings in the chambers of the heart.
Like the brightest setting sun, radiant purple Arts shine through the clouds and fill the streets.
This melody... the Gesatzsw√§chter?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Brandt? Is that you?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...Take Werner's daughter inside.
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter

attributes.content: As for you, embers of evil...
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter

attributes.content: Filthy dregs picked from the trash heap‚Äî
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter

attributes.content: ‚ÄîHow dare you defile Zwillingst√ºrme!
attributes.name: Gesatzsw√§chter
